case_vignette: A 66-year-old female with past medical history of right breast cancer treated with radiation presents with a slowly growing mass on the right breast. She states the spot initially began as a small bruise then progressively enlargened over the past few months and now spontaneously bleeds. Examination reveals a violaceous, red exophytic thick nodule on the right breast. An excisional biopsy reveals atypical pleomorphic endothelial cells lining ill-defined vascular spaces and prominent hemorrhage.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a slowly growing lump on my right breast that started off as a small bruise and now it's getting bigger and sometimes bleeds on its own.
Have you noticed any changes in your nipple or areola?
No changes in my nipple or areola, just the lump.
Have you had any family history of breast cancer?
I'm just a patient and I haven't been told of any family history of breast cancer.
Have you had any previous breast biopsies or surgeries?
Yes, I had treatment for breast cancer in the past which included radiation.
Have you been taking any medications for your current symptoms?
I haven't been taking any medications for these symptoms.
Have you noticed any changes in your menstrual cycle?
I'm 66, so I'm past the age of having menstrual cycles.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight or appetite?
No, my weight and appetite have stayed the same.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin or nails?
No changes in my skin or nails apart from the lump on my breast.
Have you noticed any changes in your energy levels or overall well-being?
No, my energy levels and overall well-being have been the same.
Final Diagnosis: Recurrent Breast Cancer.
